triples.name: Self-driving car
triples.relevance: Autonomous driving is the central task that UniAD framework addresses.

triples.name: Computer vision
triples.relevance: Perception, a core component of the framework, relies on computer vision techniques to process sensor data.

triples.name: Predictive learning
triples.relevance: The prediction task in UniAD uses predictive learning to forecast future object behaviors and trajectories.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: UniAD proposes a planning-oriented approach that leverages automated planning and scheduling concepts for autonomous vehicle path and trajectory planning.

triples.name: Multi-task learning
triples.relevance: UniAD proposes a multi-task learning framework that integrates perception, prediction, and planning with shared representations and unified query interfaces.

triples.name: Data set
triples.relevance: The nuScenes benchmark dataset is used for evaluating and validating the UniAD framework on autonomous driving tasks.
